score.title: Can you prevent the end of the world?
paragraphs: It is the near future. The end of the world is nigh. Representatives of the world’s most powerful countries have met together in a secure bunker to set right the world’s problems or, should their plans fail, to ensure their survival of the approaching apocalypse. However, who’s to say that it might not be more dangerous within the bunker?
Base around boardgames such as Risk, War on Terror and Pandemic and films such as Dr Strangelove, Whoops Apocalypse, and Mars Attacks.

The characters created first and foremost are representatives of different countires, so the relationships they have are based more often (but not always) upon the relationship between those nations. Unless you have a lot of players it’s advised that each character represents a different country.

Because most of the Fiasco takes place within the bunker of the host nation, Locations are instead replaced with Events, threats that are of great global importance. There’s no specific threat beyond those created during the set-up, but you may introduce others as the game goes on. Scenes can be set either in the main meeting room of the bunker, quiter rooms elsewhere within the complex, or outside the bunker, as a flashback.
